subject: RE: [junit] Passing parameters to methods
msgSnippet: ... Then they don t belong into the same TestCase class. Isn t that obvious? Confused, Ilja
messageBody:
junit@yahoogroups.com wrote:
>>> Sure, but you're still simulating passing parameters to methods by
>>> passing them to your constructors. Not the most intuitive way.
>>
>> It becomes more intuitive once you understand that you are
>> not passing parameters to methods, but to test cases. Doing
>> this as method parameters certainly is one way, just not the
>> Junit way.
>
> This has nothing to do with JUnit. What if you want to pass
> parameters to one test method but your other test methods
> have no interest in those parameters?

Then they don't belong into the same TestCase class. Isn't that obvious?

Confused, Ilja
